translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Bhaddāli
The Elder Yāgudāyaka’s Birth Story
Having taken a guest,
I went to the village then;
Seeing a bowl full of rice,

analyzed: saṅgha ārāmam upāgami  āraññakā  jhāyinaḥ lūkha cīvarā
translated: I went to the monastery.🔽The forest-dwellers, who had the qualities of ascetics,
who were meditators, who had coarse robes,🔽those wise ones, who delighted in solitude,
lived in the monastery.
Their destination was cut off,
of those who were well-liberated,
they did not go for alms,
because of the rice-gruel.

analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ  veda jātaḥ katañjalī
translated: With a confident mind, joyful,🔽with faith arisen, with hands raised in reverence,

original: Taṇḍulaṁ me gahetvāna,🔽yāgudānaṁ adāsahaṁ.🔽Pañcannaṁ yāguṁ datvāna,
analyzed: taṇḍulam me gahetvāna  yāgudānam adāsaha  pañca annam yāgum
translated: having taken rice,🔽I gave rice-gruel.
Having given rice-gruel to five,

analyzed: saka kamma abhiraddhā uha  tau atisamagacchaha
translated: with faith in my hands,
I was satisfied with my own deeds,
and went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.🔽And a jeweled bed🔽appeared to the group of thirty gods;
together with a group of women,

analyzed: modāmi byamham uttame  tettisa khattum devindo  deva rajjam akārayi
translated: I rejoiced in the supreme bed.🔽Thirty-three times I was Sakka,🔽the king of the gods,
thirty-two times a wheel-turning monarch,
I ruled the great kingdom.
A vast regional kingdom,
I counted them as incalculable;
In the deva world and among humans,
I experienced them myself.
When I reached my last existence,
I went forth into homelessness;
As soon as I shaved off my hair and beard,

analyzed: sabbam sampaṭivijjhaha  khayataḥ vayataḥ ca api
translated: I penetrated all of it.🔽Contemplating the body
in terms of its ending and fading away,
Before I had taken on the training rules,

analyzed: arahattam apāpuṇi  su dinnam me dānavara
translated: I attained perfection.🔽The gift of milk-rice
was a profitable trade for me;
Through that offering of milk-rice,

original: pattomhi acalaṁ padaṁ.🔽Sokaṁ pariddavaṁ byādhiṁ,🔽darathaṁ cittatāpanaṁ;
analyzed: acalam  sokam pariddavam byādhi  daratham citta tāpana
translated: I attained the unshakable state.
I do not recall ever having experienced🔽grief, despair, illness, or mental anguish
since that offering of milk-rice.
Having given milk-rice to the Sangha,
in the unsurpassed field of merit,
I experience five benefits:
Oh, how good the milk-rice was!
I am free from illness and have a beautiful appearance;
I quickly understand the Teaching;
I receive food and drink;

original: āyu pañcamakaṁ mama.🔽Yo koci vedaṁ janayaṁ,
analyzed: āyu pañcamakam mama  yaḥ koci vedam janaya
translated: and my life span is the fifth.
Whoever gives milk-rice to the Sangha
will experience these five things.
The wise one should accept🔽these five benefits.”
All that had to be done was done,
all existences have been torn away by me.
All the pollutants have been exhausted,
there is no more of this mundane state.
I will wander about,
from village to village, from town to town,
honouring the Sambuddha,
and the good Dhamma of the Dhamma.
For three thousand aeons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the gruel gift.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the venerable Yāgudāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā yāgudāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Yāgudāyakattherassāpadānaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai yāgudāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽yāgudāyaka therassa apadānam aṭṭhama
translated: The Story of the Elder Yāgudāyaka is finished.
